title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.2: REGULATIONS AND DIRECTIVES

description.narrative: By 2019, government offices at ministry levels, involved in the nutrition sector, have the tools to scale up specific nutritional interventions and essential regulations and directives are available, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and children under five utilize quality nutrition services offering high impact interventions and promoting optimal nutrition behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, government offices at ministry levels, involved in the nutrition sector, have the tools to scale up specific nutritionalinterventions and essential regulations and directives are available

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country Office provided technical support to the Government to build capacity towards the development and implementation of adequate policies and legislation for the optimal nutrition and the control of micronutrient deficiencies, as well as nutrition-sensitive interventions. The Country Office, as the lead of the Technical and Financial Partners’ Group, actively participated in the development of the Early Childhood Development Policy and the decree which created an integrated "Breastfeeding and Early Childhood Development" committee under the leadership of the SUN focal point. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2021
